str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.
But if not, else, otherwise. From ei, de, and me; but if not.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From apo and stello; set apart, i.e. to send out literally or figuratively.
An embassy, delegation, eldership. From presbeuo; seniority, i.e. an embassy.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
(a) of time: still, yet, even now, (b) of degree: even, further, more, in addition. Perhaps akin to etos; 'yet, ' still.
Far, far off, at a distance. Adverb from pro; forwards, i.e. At a distance.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Apparently from ereo; to interrogate; by implication, to request.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.
Probably from a primary verb eiro; peace; by implication, prosperity.
